## Loading the CSV

```{r}
data= read.csv("EurostatCrime2015.csv", header = TRUE)



data$"Sexual.Crime"  <- rowSums(cbind(data$"Sexual.assault", data$"Sexual.violence", data$"Rape"), na.rm = T )
data

data = data[,!(names(data) %in% c("Rape","Sexual.violence", "Sexual.assault"))]
data
typeof(data)

areComplete <- data[!complete.cases(data),]
areComplete

mydata = data[complete.cases(data), ]
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
